newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish bonds end higher, markka steady.
newsitem.headline: Finnish bonds end higher, markka steady.

text.p: 1625/1325 GMT -- Bonds end calm Wednesday session stronger with sentiment bolstered by foreign buying spree late on Tuesday and seen lasting, dealers say. Yield curve flattens slightly as long-end spread over Bunds tightens. * Markka steady vs mark, DEM/FIM seen 2.9850-3.0050 range this week.
*FIM-06 yld pct 5.99 vs 6.02 *06 gap over Bund bps 31 vs 32
*FIM-04 yld pct 5.58 vs 5.61 *FIM-99 yld pct 3.74 vs 3.75
*Sept FRAs 3.28 pct vs 3.29 *June FRAs 4.06 pct vs 4.08

Bonds ended higher on Wednesday, and brokers said sentiment was still positive following a spurt late Tuesday of foreign buying that knocked long-end yields lower and tightened the spread over Germany.
"The basic sentiment is good," one dealer said, pointing to Tuesday's large influx and continued strength in the Bund market.
"There was data again from the United States that suggested a rate hike is less and less likely," the dealer said, referring to weaker US May durable goods orders.
The markka ended steady versus the mark in calm trade, dealers said.
